2020-01-31.text: Using this website: https://t.co/jfIAn6Urhx you can convert any league stats into approximate NHL stats. So according to the website, Puljujarvi's 17 goals and 24 assists in 41 games, is roughly equivalent to 15 goals and 22 assists for 37 points in a 82-game NHL season

2020-01-30.text: This all said, I'm looking forward to February and getting back into the swing of things with school and completing my high-school at the age of 20. Thank you for taking time to read my story, if you ever need to talk to someone, shoot me a dm. Once again, thanks.

It just made me feel better. Your bravery inspired me to share my story this year, and I hope my story does the same for someone else! It took me an hour to type out my story but it needed to be done.

Throughout the years, my mental health has improved, with some phases here and there. I'm definitely in a much better place than I used to be, and I'm proud to say that. Logging into twitter today and seeing the #BellLetsTalk reminded me I'm never alone someone will always listen

I went to a new school for adults that February, and ended up dropping back out in May (due to Nova Scotia's attendance policy). However, I knew I was getting better and was on the right track. I went back to school that September and I completed a whole year!

It cause more anxiety then it helped. I then got into another therapy clinic, that I found to be a lot better for myself. Through this clinic, I learned many of my strategies for dealing with mental health I still use today, and I was educated as well.

It caused me to drop out of my grade 11 year, a month into the first semester. This was the lowest moment of my life. I felt like I had no one to turn to, nowhere to go, and nothing to do. I went to see a private therapist and I realized that wasn't for me.

I was diagnosed with depression and anxiety in the 10th grade 4 years ago, I was completely embarrassed. I thought there was something... wrong with me. My anxiety and depression was and can still be occasionally crippling.

THREAD:
#BellLetsTalk The past month leading up to today has been one of my worst anxiety and depression ridden months in years, and it's something I've battled all my life. Having poor mental health to begin with then adding in contributing factors made this month terrible.

Bert-Larkin-Mantha
AA-Filp-Zadina
Hirose-Niels- Helm
Abby-Glen-Ehn 
De la Rose.

Where would Sulak, Hicketts, Saarijarvi, and potentially McIsaac fit in this plan? Do you bring them in the following years? Do you call them up (except McIsaac because of CHL rules) for injuries?

My ideal defense core for next year would be:
DeKeyser - Hronek
Cholowski - Green
Kronwall/Ericsson/Daley - Bowey
You have a young player paired with a vet, you have perfect handedness, and you still have veteran leadership in the locker room. Only question is...

And I do think it would be beneficial to have Hronek and Cholowski learn from him and Mike Green. However, if he comes back you need to make him the 7th defenseman (which I have no confidence in the team doing). Trade/by out one of Ericsson/Daley

I do want to see the Red Wings clear out their defense core but Mickey Redmond does bring up a good point. I wouldn't mind having Kronwall come back to the team for next season, but you have to clear out other defensemen. Kronwall has been a top pair defenseman in this league

2018-06-06.text: 6) Sorry to "but actually!" you Adam on some of those points, there are many rumors flying around right now surrounding the Red Wings, and these are the most believed ones, well to me at least. Keep up the great work guys, and sorry for the long response!

5) The Red Wings would prefer to hang on to Nick Jensen, he was the best defenseman on the team last season. The Wings are rebuilding, kind of. They don't want to full-out tank, but they're going to sell off players for futures.

4) Both Ouellet and the Red Wings would like to move on from each other and have fresh starts. Ouellet wants to be somewhere he can play, and the Wings would probably want to bring up Hicketts, Hronek, or the 6th overall pick full time (probably Bouchard).
3) Holland is open to trading the 6th overall draft pick to move up, or move down in the draft. He's open for almost anything for the right price.

2) They are not shopping Athanasiou, but if a trade happens neither side would be very disappointed, and nobody would be shocked as there's some strain between him and the coaches. So could happen, but probably won't.
